articles.author: Andrew Macaskill, Villen Anganan
articles.description: Britain is confident its plan to secure the future of a U.S.-British military base on the Indian Ocean island of Diego Garcia will be ratified, despite being dismissed by the new Mauritian prime minister and an ally of President-elect Donald Trump.
articles.title: Britain confident Chagos Islands deal on military base will proceed as doubts surface

articles.author: Erin Banco, Phil Stewart
articles.description: The U.S. decision to allow Ukraine to fire American weapons deeper into Russia has not increased the risk of a nuclear attack, which is unlikely, despite Russian President Vladimir Putin's increasingly bellicose statements, five sources familiar with U.S. intelligence told Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: Nuclear attack unlikely despite Putin's warnings, US intelligence says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli tank fire hit three towns along Lebanon's southeast border with Israel on Thursday, Lebanese security sources and state media said, a day after a ceasefire barring "offensive military operations" came into force.
articles.title: Israeli tank fires at 3 south Lebanese towns, Lebanese security sources, media say

articles.author: Anastasiia Malenko, Olena Harmash, Max Hunder
articles.description: Russia unleashed its second big attack on Ukraine's energy infrastructure this month on Thursday, triggering deep power cuts across the country.
articles.title: Russia hits Ukrainian energy facilities, Kyiv sees 'despicable escalation'

articles.author: Greg Torode, Karen Lema
articles.description: Online ship trackers show that many of the vessels in the satellite photos are Chinese-registered fishing craft.
articles.title: Exclusive: Chinese ships gather near island disputed with Philippines, satellite images show

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Vladimir Putin said on Thursday that Russia would use all weapons at its disposal against Ukraine if Kyiv were to acquire nuclear arms.
articles.title: Putin says Russia would use all weapons at its disposal if Ukraine got nuclear weapons

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces stepped up bombardments on central areas and pushed tanks deeper in the north and south of the enclave.
articles.title: Israel ups bombing in central Gaza, strikes kill 17 people

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: France, which is under pressure over its stance on an international arrest warrant issued for Israel's prime minister, declined on Thursday to say whether it would be prepared to arrest Russian President Vladimir Putin under a similar warrant.
articles.title: France declines to say whether it would arrest Putin under ICC warrant

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Fifteen people have died and at least 100 more are missing after a landslide triggered by heavy rains buried dozens of homes across several villages in eastern Uganda, the prime minister's office and police said on Thursday.
articles.title: Fifteen dead, more than 100 missing in east Uganda landslide

articles.author: Laila Bassam, Tom Perry, Maya Gebeily
articles.description: With the bodies of its fighters still strewn on the battlefield, Hezbollah must bury its dead and provide succour to its supporters who bore the brunt of Israel's offensive, as the first steps on a long and costly road to recovery, four senior officials said.
articles.title: Still counting its dead, Hezbollah faces long road to recover from war
